content.question: If the carrying capacity of the population is <math alttext="2400" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2400</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> rabbits, which of the following differential equations best models the growth rate of the rabbit population with respect to time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a constant?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, 2400 minus k P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2400</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, k times, open parenthesis, 2400 minus P, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2400</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, k times the fraction 1 over P, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, 2400 minus P, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2400</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, k P, times, open parenthesis, 2400 minus P, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2400</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, k P, times, open parenthesis, 2400 minus P, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2400</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.9: (BC ONLY) Logistic Models with Differential Equations

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
